title: GRAINS-Wheat edges higher, set to finish the week up...
text: SYDNEY, Oct 18 (Reuters) - U.S. wheat futures edged higher on Friday to linger near a three-month high, as concerns about tighter global supplies pushed the grain towards weekly gains of more than 3%. FUNDAMENTALS * The most active wheat futures on the Chicago Board Of Trade were up more than 3% for the week, extending two-week gains to nearly 7%. * Wheat on Thursday hit a high of $5.27 a bushel, the highest since July 15. * The most active soybean futures were down nearly 0.5% for the week, the first weekly loss in a month. * The most active corn futures down nearly 1% for the week, the first decline since Sept. 6. * Dry weather threatens wheat production in Argentina. * Traders noted that Egypt on Wednesday bought 405,000 tonnes of Russian, French and Ukrainian wheat at prices that were roughly $6 to $9 per tonne higher than what it paid at its previous international tender on Oct. 8. * White House economic adviser Larry Kudlow said on Thursday that China's "serious commitment" to buy $40 billion to $50 billion worth of U.S. agricultural goods as part of a so-called Phase 1 trade deal would depend in part on private companies and market conditions. MARKET NEWS * The British pound traded near a five-month high against the dollar and the euro after British Prime Minister Boris Johnson and European Union leaders agreed to a new deal for Britain to exit the bloc. * Oil prices rose about 1% on Thursday after draws in U.S. fuel inventories, but gains were capped by a larger-than-expected rise in crude stockpiles and a series of weak economic figures. * Wall Street advanced on Thursday as investor sentiment was buoyed by a string of corporate earnings beats and encouraging geopolitical developments. Grains prices at 0036 GMT Contract Last Change Pct chg Two-day chg MA 30 RSI CBOT wheat 524.75 -0.75 -0.14% +2.24% 492.83 74 CBOT corn 395.00 0.25 +0.06% +0.83% 380.13 60 CBOT soy 933.50 2.00 +0.21% +0.59% 905.00 66 CBOT rice 11.99 $0.00 +0.00% +0.88% $12.02 57 WTI crude 53.99 $0.06 +0.11% +1.18% $55.39 53 Currencies Euro/dlr $1.113 $0.000 +0.04% +0.51% USD/AUD 0.6828 0.001 +0.07% +1.07% Most active contracts Wheat, corn and soy US cents/bushel. Rice: USD per hundredweight RSI 14, exponential (Reporting by Colin Packham; Editing by Shounak Dasgupta)
